Key:
(Spirits... Supposedly they are beings that
shouldn't exist.)

(When a Spirit appears in the world, a spacequake
occurs involuntarily.)

(As the name implies, it's an earthquake in
space. A massive force bears down on the region,
explodes, leaving nothing but a smoking crater.)
(It was first observed 30 years ago...)

(Eurasia's center disappeared; over 150 million
were killed in the largest calamity in mankind's
history. Also known as the Eurasia Sky Disaster.)

(Just as they had sparked in the beginning,
small-scale spacequakes began to occur
throughout the world.)

(That's why the Spirits that cause them are
known as harbingers of disaster, earning the
ire and fear of the people around them.)

(The city in which we live, Tengu City, was once
the site of such an event. On that spot, a town
was built to test the latest technology.)

(I was living a normal, average
life when she arrived.)

(Spring break had ended, and my life as a
sophomore began on April 10th. On that day,
I met my first Spirit.)
(I remember as if it were yesterday.)

(The city was destroyed, and there was a huge
crater in the ground as if a meteor had struck.
In the center of it all, she stood.)

(I couldn't take my eyes off of her. She had taken
my heart in an instant. She was so beautiful,
almost otherworldly...)

(Her powers had the potential to destroy the
world, and because of that, she was reviled and
attacked by humans. She fought in her despair.)

(I just couldn't bring myself to think that she
was the world's enemy. Not only that, I wanted to
save her from her sadness.)
(And my wish came true in the oddest way.)

(A secret organization formed to protect the
Spirits. Kotori, Commander of Ratatoskr, told me
of my ability to seal the Spirit's powers.)

(If successful, then I would be able to save the
Spirits... However, the means to do so was
shocking to say the least...)

(It was to make the Spirits fall in love.
In other words...)

(I needed to spend as much time with them
as I could, and gain their affection.)

(With the help of Kotori and the members of
Ratatoskr, I began my interactions with the
Spirits...)

(I was able to save Tohka, Yoshino... and Kotori,
who regained her powers in order to protect me.)

(Origami's parents were murdered by a Spirit five
years ago. She didn't approve of my actions.
However, she has slowly grown to understand me.)

(There was one Spirit I couldn't save. A girl who
transferred to my school without hiding that she
was a Spirit. A girl with black hair... Kurumi.)

(As for her, there were a lot of instances that
made me doubt her. Neither Tohka nor Yoshino
bore any ill will toward anyone.)

(However, Kurumi was different. Kurumi killed
people of her own volition.)

(After hearing this from Tohka, I decided to save
Kurumi once more.)

(Kurumi was the other me... She claimed that if
she hadn't met me and instead stayed alone in her
suffering, she would have grown insane...)

(What Kurumi did was something
you can't just forgive.)

(But even if that were the case, I wanted to be
the one who could forgive her. I wanted to give
her the chance to start over.)

(But my wish didn't come true. Kurumi was defeated
by Kotori, and disappeared...)

(During that time, I met a girl claiming to be my
real little sister, Mana Takamiya. Injured during
the battle with Kurumi, she is in the hospital...)

(Tohka, Yoshino, Kurumi, Kotori, and Origami
(although she isn't a Spirit). Ever since I met
them, I...)
(Hm? Who was that... Uh...?)

(Hm?! I-I think she was...
That's right! That girl!)
...Was I dreaming...?

(I woke up, but I still couldn't distinguish
reality from the dream. A strange, flowy
sensation lingered...)
(The girl I saw at the end...)

(I thought back on the girl who seemed like family
but whom I couldn't recognize. I changed and
headed for the living room.)
Shido, you're late! When's breakfast?
Sorry, sorry... Wait, huh?
Yoo-hoo, Shido-kun. Did you sleep well?
G-Good morning. Shido-san...!
G-Good morning... Why are you two here...?

their checkup they'd come to live with us until
the Spirit Mansion was fixed.

O-Oh right, I guess you did say
something like that...

Probably time for a brain scan at the hospital,
though I'm not sure if the machine can read
cobwebs.

Ngh... H-Hey, don't blame me. My head still feels
fuzzy. I'm not at my best.

Maybe it's because you were doing something until
late last night with Origami Tobiichi.
I didn't do anything with her! You know that!

Yeah. I guess I haven't ever considered that you
could do anything at all.
Oof...

Hm? Shido... Did something happen between you and
Origami Tobiichi yesterday?
N-Nothing happened. Don't worry, Tohka!
Are you sure?
Y-Yes, I'm sure!
Okay, so long as you're okay!
Shido?
Hm? Wh-What is it?!

currently very unstable.

If they continue to go berserk without being able
to control themselves, God knows what kind of
casualties we could suffer.
So be careful about what you say or do.
Yeah, I know.
As long as you know.
(Kotori's right. I need to be careful.)

All right, let's have some breakfast!
We'll be late.
Yay! Breakfast!

It's been a while since I've had
your breakfast, Shido.
Hey Kotori, are you in a daze too? I always mak—
Hm? Oh, that's right. Normally—
Shido?! Is it ready yet?!
Yeah, all right! I'm almost done.
Shido, hurry!
Don't rush me. I'm almost done!

(With the hungry Tohka now satisfied, we were able
to finish up breakfast. I headed toward the door,
excited to go to school.)
Okay, Yoshino, can you stay home?
O-Okay...!
Shido-kuuuun, be careful okay?! You just\nrecovered, so don't push yourself.
O-Okay, I'll be careful.
Later!
H-Have a nice day...!
Shido, you're slow!
Sorry!
Gosh, what were you doing?

I asked Yoshino and Yoshinon
to take care of the house.
I see. Be sure to speed it up next time.
I'll be careful. Let's go—Hey, wait!
Hm?
What's the matter?
What's that...?
That big tower...
What? Is the Neo Tengu Tower that weird?
Huh...? O-Oh, nothing... It's just...

(Before me stood the usual houses and scenery I
was used to. But beyond that, in the center of
town, stood this abnormally shaped building.)

(It stood out so obviously from the buildings
around it, almost as if it were from another
world...)

Hey, Shido. Are you serious? There are only so
many times I can joke about calling an ambulance
for you.

I can't believe you'd forget our town's new
symbol. The Neo Tengu Tower.
Neo Tengu Tower...? That thing?

It was just finished, and still a hot topic.
Supposedly, it's gonna open up in August.
R-Really...?

(Did this thing really exist? I totally don't
remember... Rather, there's no way I wouldn't
notice a building like that.)
Shido!

(Someone called my name, and I turned around
to see a girl standing there.)
Oh! U-Um...
Shido? What's the matter?
N-No... Sorry. Good morning, Rinne!
Gosh, Rinne-oneechan, what's gotten into you?

Oh... N-Nothing at all.
Good morning, Shido, Kotori-chan.
Yeah.
Rinne, good morning!
Hehe. Good morning, Tohka-chan.

(Did I just imagine that...? For a split second...
I felt like I forgot Rinne...)

(Rinne Sonogami. She's almost as close to me as
Kotori is.)

(Rinne lives next door, and we've been classmates
ever since we were little.)

(We've been together all that time, too.
Our parents got along, so it was natural
that she was always around.)

(I don't know whether to feel pathetic or just
thankful, but until I met Origami or Tohka,

(Because my parents were always out of town, Rinne would

(In other words, she's like family. And a very

(To forget her... Man, I must still
be out of it...)

But I'm fine now.

Yeah, thanks!
Huh...? U-Um... Are you, um—
Hey, Shido... Are you seriously okay?
Huh?
Rinne, good morning!
Hehe. Good morning, Tohka-chan, Kotori-chan.
Morning, Rinne-oneechan!
R-Rinne...?

Good morning, Shido... I was waiting for you for

Shido, good morning. If you take your time like

What's the matter, Rinne?

Hey, Shido? I think I noticed something

Huh?

Huh? What?! Wh-Why didn't you say so, Rinne?!
Let's run!
Okay!
Come on! Tohka, Kotori, let's go!
Sh-Shido! Wait!

(And that's how my life at school
started up again.)
